ğ“‹´ ğ“Šª ğ“ ğ“‚ spout (plural spouts) A tube or lip through which liquid or steam is poured or discharged. I dropped my china teapot, and its spout broke. A waterspout (â€œchannel through which water is discharged, especially from the gutters of a roofâ€). A stream or discharge of liquid, typically with some degree of force. A stream of water that falls from higher to lower; a (typically thin) waterfall. A similar stream or fall of earth, rock, etc. A waterspout (â€œwhirlwind or tornado that forms over waterâ€). The mixture of air and water thrown up from the blowhole of a whale. (Australia) A hollow stump formed when a tree branch breaks off.
